column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column13: The Personal Relationship Policy requires the disclosure of any close personal relationships with a direct or indirect report that Goodman's team members hold a position of influence or seniority over, which may give rise to an actual, perceived or potential conflict of interest, including the perception of favourable treatment.
column20: Personal Relationship Policy, conflict of interest, favourable treatment

column13: Goodman has implemented a Related Party Policy, which sets out the basic principles for dealing with transactions between Goodman and its managed partnerships. It also includes identification and management of conflicts of interest and appropriate resourcing with dedicated team members and information barriers in place to separate interests where appropriate.
column20: Related Party Policy, managed partnership, conflict of interest

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: Goodman's Ethical Concerns Policy encourages disclosers to report instances of improper conduct. Goodman is committed to protecting persons who disclose improper conduct under this policy, including the person's identity (confidentiality).
column20: Ethical Concerns Policy, improper conduct, confidentiality

column13: The Goodman Industrial Trust (GIT) Compliance Plan sets out the procedures. It controls Goodman Funds Management Limited (GFML) as the responsible entity of GIT (a registered managed investment scheme). It applies to comply with its obligations under the Corporations Act, GFML's Australian Financial Services Licence and the constitution of GIT. Annual compliance monitoring is conducted through the Compliance Plan checklist.
column20: GIT Compliance Plan, GFML, compliance monitoring

column13: Goodman implemented a Compliance Framework to assist in proactively managing its compliance obligations and to demonstrate its commitment to legal and regulatory compliance and ethical and social responsibilities. The Audit, Risk and Compliance Committee has oversight of Goodman's Compliance Framework, which provides a consistent and structured approach to promoting a positive compliance culture and meeting compliance obligations by aligning them to business processes so that compliance becomes a normal part of business operations.
column20: Compliance Framework, compliance obligation, social responsibility

column7: Goodman is a Climate Active, GRESB, and Greenpower member.

column13: Goodman's Market Disclosure Policy outlines the procedures followed internally to facilitate compliance with continuous disclosure laws, periodic reporting obligations and timely and full disclosure of material through ASX. Goodman announces presentation materials on the ASX and its corporate website for any new and substantive investor or analyst presentations ahead of the event.
column20: Market Disclosure Policy, continuous disclosure, ASX

column13: Three years ago, Goodman's Continental Europe (CE) team began Sustainability Week to raise awareness and inspire action in the region's team of around 200 employees. This year, the week started with an exclusive keynote by British architect Michael Pawlyn, known for his work in biomimetic architecture or 'designing with nature'. Sustainability Week continued with biodiversity facts shared on Goodman's internal social media platform, Yammer and with employees contributing ideas, photos and videos.

column7: Goodman is not opposed to collective bargaining, although the relationship Goodman has with its employees means it has no single global collective bargaining agreement.

column13: Goodman's 2030 Sustainability Strategy is helping to shift its business into a resilient and low-carbon company. Goodman focuses on the areas with the greatest control and potential impact and can collaborate with its stakeholders for combined influence. By developing and managing a global portfolio of modern, high-quality and efficient industrial properties and places, Goodman will continue to use its influence to make a meaningful difference to its people, customers, investors, community, and planet.

column7: Goodman's material topics are sustainable properties and places; people, culture, and community; and corporate governance and performance.

column13: At Huiyang Industrial Park, Goodman designed two dedicated shared social, health and well-being spaces for customers as part of the 424,706 sqm gross floor area. The 1,600 sqm wellness park is protected from the weather and has basketball, table tennis, badminton courts, and exercise equipment for individual use. Team sports are organised by customers and by Goodman's onsite Property Services team.
column20: Well-being space, Huiyang Industrial Park, wellness park

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: Goodman generated $1,969 million in revenues in 2023.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: In 2019, Goodman engaged climate consultants South Pole to support completing a scenario-based climate risk assessment aligned with the TCFD guidelines. The scenario-based risk assessment included physical and transition risk assessments.
column20: Scenario-based climate risk assessment, climate consultant, TCFD

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: In Europe, Goodman adopted a Green Finance Framework, aligned to best practice green bond and loan guidelines, enabling the business to channel investments towards its sustainable investments. In addition, the Goodman European Partnership has transitioned to an Article 8 product that promotes environmental and social characteristics under the European Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation.
column20: Green Finance Framework, green bond, sustainable investment

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: In its China portfolio, Goodman entered into a Green Loan linked to LEED Gold certification of its Wujiang Industrial Park development and four unsecured sustainability-linked loans connected to its ongoing GRESB performance score.
column20: Green Loan, LEED Gold, GRESB performance score

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Goodman implements sustainable design features in its developments. Goodman builds on those by actively engaging with customers to understand their current and potential future design requirements and sustainability priorities. Goodman has pragmatic discussions with its customers on design to help them achieve their sustainability targets. Goodman typically focuses on energy efficiency, renewable energy and reducing embodied carbon in areas it can control and where it can have influence across its value chain.
column20: Sustainable design feature, future design requirement, energy efficiency

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: Goodman's Australian business collaborated with Daikin to target a 6-star Green Star Design and As Built v1.3 and WELL Core rating for Daikin's new facility at Goodman's Gateway@Murarrie industrial development in Brisbane. As Daikin's global business designs, manufactures and maintains air conditioners, air filters and purification systems, it was eager to demonstrate how it can 'enhance people's lives by creating ideal air at its showroom, office, and distribution facility at the new development.
column20: Green Star design, WELL Core rating, Daikin
